data.title: F. Peter Phillips '87
data.meta_description: Distinguished Adjunct Professor of Law; Director, Alternative Dispute Resolution Skills Program; Faculty Advisor, Dispute Resolution Team
data.text:
Book Chapters

“International Mediation and Conciliation,” in Alternative Dispute Resolution Practice Guide (Thomson/West, 2020)

“Conflict Resolution and Spiritual Congruity,” in Transforming Justice, Lawyers and the Practice of Law (Carolina Academic Press, 2017)

Chapter Contributor, Alternative Dispute Resolution in Practice (Insurance Institute of London, 2011)

Chapter Contributor, Reality Testing, Mediation Techniques (International Bar Association, 2010)

Articles

“Ancient and Comely Order: Arbitration in the Religious Society of Friends,” Journal of Dispute Resolution 81 (2016)

“Recent American Court Decisions Involving Breaches of Mediation Confidentiality,” IBA Mediation News (2013)

“‘There is a World Elsewhere’: Preliminary Studies on Alternatives to Interest-based Bargaining,” 13 Cardozo Journal of Conflict Resolution 413 (2012)

“Mediating Corporate/Human Rights Disputes in the Tumultuous Sea of Social Networking: Do You Have What it Takes?” co-authored with J.D. Taillant, IBA Mediation News (2011)

“Recent Developments in Commercial Mediation in China,” New York Dispute Resolution Lawyer (2010)

“Diversity in ADR: More Difficult to Accomplish Than First Thought,” 15(3) Dispute Resolution Magazine (2009)

“Commercial Mediation in China: the Challenge of Shifting Paradigms,” Contemporary Issues in International Arbitration and Mediation: The 2008 Fordham Papers (2009)

“Managing Risk Through Drafting ADR Clauses,” ALI/ABA Practical Lawyer (2009)

“The European Directive on Commercial Mediation: What It Says, What it Means, and What It Doesn’t” New York State Bar Association Section of Dispute Resolution (2008)

“The Challenges of International Commercial Dispute Resolution,” Focus Europe (2007)

“New Protocol for Reinsurance Coverage Disputes” Risk Management Magazine (2007)

“How to Stop Costly Litigation from Ruining Your Results,” co-authored with P. Moss, FAC (2007)

“How Conflict Resolution Emerged within the Commercial Sector,” Alternatives to the High Cost of Litigation (2007)

“Best Practices in Managing Reinsurance Disputes,” co-authored with P. Moss, Declarations (2007)

“ADR: It Remains a White, Male Game,” The National Law Journal (2006)

“Success in China: Adjust Your Expectations and Be Ready to Change,” Global Link (2006)

“Ten Ways to Sabotage Dispute Management,” HR Magazine (2004)

Editing

Editor and Contributor, ADR Deskbook for the Business Lawyer: A Cross-Disciplinary Workbook (American Bar Association, 2016)

Editor, Managing Franchise Relationships Through Mediation (CPR Institute, 2009)

Editor, Resource Book for Managing Employment Disputes (CPR Institute, 2004)

Editor, How Companies Manage Employment Disputes (CPR Institute, 2002)

Other Writing

Business Conflict Blog (2009 – present)

Writer, Facilitator, and Director of “Conflict in Quaker Meetings: Crisis or Opportunity,” (New York Yearly Meeting of the Religious Society of Friends, 2013)

Writer and Co-Director of four films on “Building Corporate/Community Relations,” (2012)

“Mediation Committee Sessions,” IBA Newsletter (2010)

“Corporate Social Responsibility and Non-Judicial Remedies for Human Rights Violations: Is It Time for the Dog that Didn’t Bark?” IBA Mediation Newsletter (2009)

“ADR as a Tool for Management and for Corporate Governance,” International Bar Association Mediation Committee Newsletter (2006)

White Paper, CPR Response to Questionnaire Concerning Proposal for Directive (2005)

White Paper, Feasibility Study on Commercial Mediation in the Russian Federation (2002)

White Paper, Response to European Commission’s Green Paper on ADR in Civil and Commercial Disputes (2002)
